title: Smiling on a Woodland Path: Companionship in Nature
caption: A man and woman hike a forest path, laughing as sunlight filters through the trees.

sentences: Start with an overview sentence about the setting and the main action.
Mention two foreground details and one background detail as evidence.
Explain the mood using facial expressions, posture, and lighting.

questions.question: What is the best overall description of 'Forest Trail Walk'?
choices: A calm indoor meeting with formal presentations
People in a public setting engaged in an everyday activity
A private ceremony with an audience and a stage
A laboratory experiment with specialized equipment
questions.explanation: The scene title and context point to a public setting and routine activity rather than a formal ceremony, lab, or meeting.

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Forest Trail Walk'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Forest Trail Walk' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Forest Trail Walk' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Forest Trail Walk'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Forest Trail Walk'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Forest Trail Walk', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Forest Trail Walk' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

exercises.name: 30-second photo description
exercises.prompt: Describe the photo in 3 sentences: (1) setting, (2) people + action, (3) feeling.

exercises.name: 45-second structured speaking
exercises.prompt: Speak with structure: overview → details → inference → wrap-up.
steps: Overview: one sentence about the scene.
Details: 2–3 details (foreground/background).
Inference: make 1 reasonable guess.

tips: Use present continuous for what you see.

exercises.name: 6-minute paragraph (TOEFL style)
exercises.prompt: Write one paragraph (80–120 words) describing the photo and adding one personal connection.

model.en: The photo shows smiling on a woodland path: companionship in nature with a calm, inspiring atmosphere. In the foreground, the people seem focused and relaxed as they take in the view. In the background, the landscape looks wide and dramatic, which makes the moment feel special. I have had a similar experience on a weekend trip, and it reminded me how refreshing nature can be. After this moment, they will probably keep exploring and take more photos.

proDescriptions.text: In this photo, a man and a woman are hiking along a dirt path in a lush green forest. They wear backpacks and practical outdoor clothes, and they look at each other while laughing Overall, the mood feels energetic and realistic.

proDescriptions.label: Academic Description
proDescriptions.text: The image portrays a man and a woman hiking on a woodland trail, wearing backpacks and outdoor clothing, smiling at each other. Visual elements such as lighting, posture, and setting provide contextual cues that support an interpretation of mood and purpose. The composition balances foreground action with background environment to communicate a clear everyday scenario.

proDescriptions.label: Narrative Style
proDescriptions.text: The moment feels frozen in time: A man and a woman are hiking along a dirt path in a lush green forest. Small details—light, movement, and expressions—turn an ordinary scene into a memorable snapshot.

sceneDescription: A man and a woman are hiking along a dirt path in a lush green forest. They wear backpacks and practical outdoor clothes, and they look at each other while laughing. Sunlight shines through the trees, making the scene feel fresh, relaxed, and energetic.

lessonOverview.en: This lesson builds both everyday and academic language for describing the photo clearly, making inferences, and organizing ideas for TOEFL tasks.

A man and woman hike a forest path, laughing as sunlight filters through the trees. اطرافشان 2 backpacks، Forest path و Trees and leaves دیده می‌شود و فضا Cheerful، Relaxed و Connected است. لباس‌ها، مثل Backpacks و Outdoor hoodie/jacket (man: olive/green) هم با موقعیت و محیط هماهنگ است.

grammarUsed.en: Present continuous for actions now, there is/are for visible objects, and adjectives/prepositions for setting and mood.
grammarUsed.fa: حال استمراری برای کارهای در جریان، there is/are برای اشیای قابل مشاهده، و صفت/حروف اضافه برای توصیف محیط و حس.

en.tense: Present Continuous (am/is/are + V‑ing) for actions happening now in the photo.
howToBuild: Choose the subject (who?): they / the family / the coworkers.
Pick an action you can SEE and use am/is/are + V‑ing.
Add place details with prepositions: at, in, on, near.
Add one short feeling sentence: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: They are Walking and chatting.
There are 2 backpacks and Forest path in Forest trail.
The atmosphere feels Cheerful.

fa.tense: حال استمراری (am/is/are + فعل ing) برای کارهایی که همین الآن در عکس در حال انجام است.
howToBuild: اول فاعل را انتخاب کن (چه کسی؟): they / the family / the coworkers.
یک کاری که در عکس می‌بینی انتخاب کن و با am/is/are + ing بساز.
جزئیات مکان را با حروف اضافه اضافه کن: at, in, on, near.
یک جمله کوتاه درباره حس اضافه کن: They look… / The atmosphere feels…
examples: آن‌ها در حال Walking and chatting هستند.
در Forest trail 2 backpacks و Forest path دیده می‌شود.
فضا Cheerful به نظر می‌رسد.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself on Forest trail. A man and woman hike a forest path, laughing as sunlight filters through the trees. At first, I noticed 2 backpacks, Forest path, Trees and leaves and the way people were walking and chatting. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Backpacks, Outdoor hoodie/jacket (man: olive/green)) and their expressions made the scene feel cheerful, relaxed, connected. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Forest trail بودم. A man and woman hike a forest path, laughing as sunlight filters through the trees. اول 2 backpacks، Forest path و Trees and leaves را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Walking and chatting. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Backpacks و Outdoor hoodie/jacket (man: olive/green)) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Cheerful، Relaxed و Connected به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, they walked and chatting.
Then, they checked 2 backpacks and continued.
Finally, they felt Cheerful about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، They walked and chatting.
بعد، They 2 backpacks را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Cheerful بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as 2 backpacks, Forest path, Trees and leaves are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like looking at each other while hiking can signal feelings such as cheerful, relaxed, connected. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل 2 backpacks، Forest path و Trees and leaves فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Looking at each other while hiking چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Cheerful، Relaxed و Connected را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: They have already handled similar situations before.
They have learned to stay Cheerful in Forest trail.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: They قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
They یاد گرفته است در Forest trail Cheerful بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment on Forest trail, one small change could create a big problem. If 2 backpacks, Forest path had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Forest trail دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر 2 backpacks و Forest path نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If they had checked 2 backpacks earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Cheerful.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر They زودتر 2 backpacks را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Cheerful بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
